## Data Collection & Validation Workshop for MSP

**Focus:** Building capacity in data collection protocols, quality assurance, and validation techniques for Marine Spatial Planning initiatives in coastal Tanzania.
:::

## Workshop Overview

**Date & Time:** To be announced  
**Location:** SOAF-UDSM, Dar es Salaam  
**Duration:** 3 days  
**Target Participants:** Government officials, NGO staff, academic researchers, community representatives

### Workshop Objectives

- Establish standardized data collection protocols for MSP
- Train participants in data quality assurance and validation methods
- Build local capacity for sustainable data management
- Ensure data consistency across coastal districts (Mkoani, Mkuranga)
- Develop community engagement strategies for data validation

### Topics Covered

- MSP Data Framework & Requirements
- Data Collection Best Practices
- Quality Assurance & Validation Protocols
- Spatial Data Management
- Community Participation in Data Validation
- Data Documentation & Metadata Standards

document.getElementById('eventRegistrationForm').addEventListener('submit', function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
  
  const fullName = document.getElementById('fullName').value;
  const email = document.getElementById('email').value;
  const phone = document.getElementById('phone').value || 'Not provided';
  const organization = document.getElementById('organization').value;
  const role = document.getElementById('role').value;
  const gender = document.getElementById('gender').value;
  const origin = document.getElementById('origin').value;
  const experience = document.getElementById('experience').value;
  const interests = document.getElementById('interests').value;
  
  // Validate required fields
  if (!fullName || !email || !organization || !role || !gender || !origin || !experience || !interests) {
    alert('Please fill in all required fields (marked with *)');
    return;
  }
  
  // Get existing registrations
  const registrations = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('msp_registrations') || '[]');
  
  // Create new registration
  registrations.push({
    name: fullName,
    email: email,
    phone: phone,
    organization: organization,
    role: role,
    gender: gender,
    origin: origin,
    experience: experience,
    interests: interests,
    timestamp: new Date().toLocaleString()
  });
  
  // Save to localStorage
  localStorage.setItem('msp_registrations', JSON.stringify(registrations));
  
  // Show success message
  document.getElementById('successMessage').style.display = 'block';
  
  // Reset form
  document.getElementById('eventRegistrationForm').reset();
  
  // Log for debugging
  console.log('Registration saved:', { fullName, email, organization, gender, origin, experience, interests });
});
</script>

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Q: Who should attend this workshop?**  
A: Government officials working on MSP, NGO representatives, researchers, community leaders, and anyone involved in data collection or validation for coastal management initiatives.

**Q: Do I need prior experience in data management?**  
A: No prior experience is required. We accommodate all experience levels, from beginners to advanced practitioners.

**Q: What is the cost of participation?**  
A: Pricing and fee information will be provided upon confirmation. Some support may be available for government staff and community representatives.

**Q: Will training materials be provided?**  
A: Yes, comprehensive training materials, data collection templates, and validation checklists will be provided to all participants.

**Q: How will this workshop help my organization?**  
A: This workshop will strengthen your organization's data management capacity, ensure consistency with national MSP standards, and improve the quality of spatial data for decision-making.

**Q: Will there be follow-up support after the workshop?**  
A: Yes, we provide ongoing technical support and can conduct on-site training at your organization if needed.
